title: Parameterized SPARQL queries don't work unless the variable is in the projection list
description:
I think I've fooled myself into thinking this was working how I'd have
expected it to but I'm not so sure that I'm doing this right...

I have the following SPARQL query that should return the object URI of the
subject's refs:range thus:

  PREFIX owl:  <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#>
  PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
  PREFIX rdf:  <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

  SELECT ?o
  FROM <http://bblfish.net/work/atom-owl/2006-06-06/>
  WHERE {<http://bblfish.net/work/atom-owl/2006-06-06/#title> rdfs:range
?o .}



and this works fine as a static SPARQL query and returns the single result
of:

<http://bblfish.net/work/atom-owl/2006-06-06/#TextContent>




However, if I want to parameterise the query so that I can pass in the
subject at run-time I have been using this invocation:


  let $modelReference :=
'http://bblfish.net/work/atom-owl/2006-06-06/#title'
  return
  xdmp:sparql('
    PREFIX owl:  <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#>
    PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
    PREFIX rdf:  <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

    SELECT DISTINCT ?o
    FROM <http://bblfish.net/work/atom-owl/2006-06-06/>
    WHERE {$modelReference rdfs:range ?o .}
    ',
    map:entry('modelReference', sem:iri($modelReference))
  )


In this case I get a sequence of all object URIs for triples that have the
rdfs:range predicate. This of course make sense in and of itself so I'm
guessing I'm not doing something right in binding the modelReference IRI
value to the SPARQL query.
samplequery:
let $modelReference :=
'http://bblfish.net/work/atom-owl/2006-06-06/#title'
  return
  xdmp:sparql('
    PREFIX owl:  <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#>
    PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
    PREFIX rdf:  <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

    SELECT DISTINCT ?o
    FROM <http://bblfish.net/work/atom-owl/2006-06-06/>
    WHERE {$modelReference rdfs:range ?o .}
    ',
    map:entry('modelReference', sem:iri($modelReference))
  )

<http://bblfish.net/work/atom-owl/2006-06-06/#xhtml> <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#editorialNote> "Note that there is a tricky question concerning the xml div element. The xml:lang and xml:base elements are not in fact part of xhtml and it has been argued on the atom mailing list (28 June 2006) that the div is *not* part of the xhtml. We could have this be a special literal with the div, or we could remove the div and push the xml:lang and xml:base down (this would work only if there is one element beneath I suppose) or we would have to use the awol:lang and :base relations on the :Content object. "@en.

changeHistory.comment: Please attach content if possible, rather than pasting in.

This mechanism does work, but only if the name of the variable passed in is returned from the select expression rather than projected out. This is probably unhelpful, but I don't think it needs fixing before 7.0-e1, so I'm moving this bug to 7.0-ea2.

I'm thinking about declaring this a "feature" not a bug. How hard is it to live with this position?

The problem is that it's really hard to optimize a query when you don't know which variables will be passed in during query execution.

From mailing list discussion, there's this case: (all examples against a kennedy dataset)

It works when ?x is bound to a single IRI:

sem:sparql("describe ?x", map:entry("x", sem:iri("http://example.org/kennedy/person1")))

 but when bound to a sequence of IRIs, the query returns empty.

sem:sparql("describe ?x", map:entry("x", (sem:iri("http://example.org/kennedy/person1"),sem:iri("http://example.org/kennedy/person2"))))

I'm not sure what the proper behavior is when a single variable is bound to a sequence, though I recall earlier discussion suggesting it would work. If that turns out not to be the case, I'm interested in alternative ways to make the original query  'describe (sequence of IRIs)' happen.
bug:20710 Fixed SPARQL external variables to work anywhere in a query

Fixed.

Now sequences of input bindings are not allowed - only a single map is allowed. Variables specified in the single map become global external variables for the query, and the value of those variables is fixed for the execution of the query.
Sample query is added into regression, other testing about this part is in other sparql testing.
